content.rendered:
What is a Producer?

A Producer is someone who is responsible for launching and organizing productions for a project. They are in charge of hiring the Director, Actors, and other crew for the production and generally coordinating the set and all the people involved.

Where does a Producer work?

  • Film/TV sets
  • Theaters
  • Other performing arts companies

How much does a Producer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Producer is $36,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Producers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Film majors
  • Drama majors
  • Media studies majors
Search Producer jobs on Handshake

Producers skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Producers succeed in their work:

  • Great organizational skills
  • Knowledge of media production
  • Strong leadership and team building skills
  • Creativity

What are some common questions about Producers?

Q: What is a Producer’s role in a movie?

A: Producers are the ones that pitch movies to studios, securing fundings, and then manage what happens on set to make sure everything runs smoothly.
